text: John Banks Hollingworth was Archdeacon of Huntingdon from 25 February 1828 until his death on 9 February 1856.British History On-line Hollingworth was born in 1780, educated at Peterhouse, CambridgeVenn, John & Venn, John Archibald. Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900, Cambridge University Press Part II vol. iii p417 and ordained in 1804. He held incumbencies at Little St Mary's, Cambridge and St Margaret Lothbury; and was Norrisian Professor of Divinity from 1824 to 1838.Divinity, Cambridge ==References== Category:1803 births Category:Alumni of Peterhouse, Cambridge Category:Norrisian Professors of Divinity Category:Archdeacons of Huntingdon Category:1856 deaths
title: John Hollingworth (priest)
